context: the patient's main complaint is vertigo.
the patient is having recurrent attacks of vertigo and imbalance over the last few years
with no concurrent tinnitus or hearing impairment.
with no concurrent tinnitus or hearing impairment.
otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes
otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes with central weber test
otoscopy: showed bilateral intact tympanic membranes with central weber test and bilateral positive rinne.
frenzel glasses examination: no spontaneous, end gaze nystagmus.
dix-hallpike: showed no positional nystagmus excluding benign paroxysmal positional vertigo.
vestibulocular reflex [halmagyi test]: showed corrective saccades giving the impression of decompensated vestibular hypofunction.
the patient was advised to continue her vestibular rehabilitation exercises
and the additional medical treatment of betahistine at 24 mg dose bid.
planned for electronystagmography to document the degree of vestibular hypofunction.
